text: Ganisa floresiaca is a moth in the family Eupterotidae. It was described by Nässig in 2009. It is found on Flores. The wingspan is about 46 mm. The ground colour of the forewings is pale greyish-brown, with a postmedian black line parallel to three to four crenulate lines in a semicircular curve to the costa. The hindwings are usually without a discal spot and the pattern is hardly visible., 2009: Two new species of the genus Ganisa WALKER, 1855 from Sulawesi and Flores, Indonesia (Lepidoptera: Eupterotidae). Entomofauna 30: 453-464. Full article: Adults have been recorded on wing from February to April. ==References== Category:Moths described in 2009 Category:Eupterotinae
title: Ganisa floresiaca
